authors: Jacob Polychronis For Daily Mail Australia
description: The iconic Caramel Choc Dip flavour was first released in Australia almost 25 years ago and was a massive hit with 90s children. Streets said it has been re-released based on popular demand.
title: Caramel Choc Dip Paddle Pop re-released in Australia
title_page: Caramel Choc Dip Paddle Pop re-released in Australia | Daily Mail Online
text:
A flood of appeals from Australians to bring back their favourite childhood ice cream has led to Streets re-releasing the Caramel Choc Dip Paddle Pop.
The iconic ice cream flavour was first released almost 25 years ago and was a massive hit with children of the 90s.
Now nostalgic fans will have the opportunity once more to indulge in the iconic ice cream after it was brought back to Australian stores on Thursday.
The iconic Caramel Choc Dip flavour was first released in Australia almost 25 years ago and was a massive hit with 90s children
Streets Senior Brand Manager Scott Mingl said the decision to return the Caramel Choc Dip was based on popular demand.
'We have been inundated with letters, calls, emails and social media requests from fans asking us to bring back their favourite flavours,' Mr Mingl said.
'The popular Caramel Choc Dip was high on that list.'
Despite being a classic of the 90s, Mr Mingl said the re-release is also aimed at introducing the flavour to younger generations.
'Paddle Pop resonates with so many Australians across young and older generations.
'Now Aussies have the chance to revisit their cherished memories of the brand and share them with even younger generations too.'
The Caramel Choc Dip Paddle Pop is available now in supermarkets and convenience stores, however only for a limited time, according to Pedestrian TV.
